entry.title: My corp profile does not sync on none of my corp devices (laptop macbook or linux workstation P520)
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem I reimaged the workstation following go/glinux-secure-boot-migration and then no extentions or bookmarks (bookmarks are more important) never synced. I am waiting for the sync since ~25th of March, so almost a month.
I reinstalled chrome on laptop and tried to install Beta canary, clear the data - nothing worked.
# Problem Description The problem is that my carefully cataloged bookmarks does not sync. I have 1000-2000 links in bookmarks split into directories - up to 4 levels deep hierarchy .
Please find the output from: chrome://sync-internals/ Here is internal sync on the workstation: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4v8VMRfrvVXZdhZ https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8S3dMTrxMYmuPRh
Here is internal sync on the laptop (macbook): https://screenshot.googleplex.com/68xJZjvVPZP4m87 https://screenshot.googleplex.com/B2owixTxDQAmMjN
# Summary My corp profile does not sync on none of my corp devices (laptop macbook or linux workstation P520)
# Additional Data Category: Sync \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Selecting the Fetch/XHR filter in network tab causes the waterfall chart items to become misaligned
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. After modifying the server logic to improve speed, I wanted to measure the response time as a waterfall item from the client. 2. I activated the Fetch/XHR option to see only the necessary parts. 3. It was fine at first, but as the responses accumulated, the sorting started to go wrong. 4. When I changed it to the "all" option, I confirmed that the sorting was correct no matter how many responses accumulated.
# Problem Description When the Fetch/XHR option is enabled, I've noticed a misalignment in the sorting of waterfall items. As more responses accumulate, the misalignment worsens, and it seems the scroll is focused on the waterfall items, causing the scroll to malfunction
# Summary Selecting the Fetch/XHR filter in network tab causes the waterfall chart items to become misaligned
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): web_ui_mocha_browser_test.cc(135): Value of: RunTestOnWebContents(web_contents, file, trigger, skip_test_loader)\n Actual: false (Mocha test failures detected in file: chromeos/diagnostics/diagnostics_app_test.js, triggered by 'mocha.run()')\nExpected: true

entry.title: launchQueue.setConsumer() callback never runs for specific files in MV3
entry.content:
Even if launchQueue object is in the window, the launchQueue.setConsumer() callback never runs. If it runs and provide the information about the file handle is missing then we can able to display file not found message to user.
How to reproduce the issue? 1.Open a document in the QO extension(using double tap operation in CROS). 2.Bookmark the opened document. 3.Close the tab in which the bookmarked document is open. 4.Try to open the same document using the bookmark.

entry.title: Recording is running very slow and the Webstore page is also responding very slow
entry.content:
Chrome Version :126.0.6434.0 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable) Revision :f75eee6d52161222fe8d668180bbf0e00c005194-refs/branch-heads/6434@{#1}
OS: Win(10)
Pre Conditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome and Open NTP and Right Click and Inspect 2. Click on more tabs and select Recorder and click on Webstore Icon in NTP. 3. Click on Create a new recording and Start recording. 4. Try to select some options in Webstore page and Observe. 5. Recording is running very slow and the Webstore page is also responding very slow.
Actual Result : Recording is running very slow and the Webstore page is also responding very slow.
Expected Result : Recording shouldn't run very slow and the Webstore page should respond normally.
This Issue is exists from M-115 onwards. So Raising it as a NR Issue.
Hence this is Non-Regression Issue, Making the Status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Please find the attached screencast below..! https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yLuPPiqtoY9gy3s2FjqHk9U9BsKG_BXp/view?usp=sharing
Note: 1. This issue is able to repro on Stable #124.0.6367.61, Beta #125.0.6422.4 and Dev #126.0.6423.2
Thank You...!!

entry.title: dropEffect not set properly in case of dragEnd and drop events
entry.content: dropEffect is not set properly and spec https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/dnd.html#dndevents is also ambiguous and leaves it as platform conventions. It should be set based on conventions in dragEnd and drop events.

entry.title: contenteditable with opacity and a subpixel translate transform becomes blurry on edit
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create a contenteditable div, with a `transform: translate(0.5px, 0.5px)` and `opacity: 0.5` 2. Click it 3. See that it becomes blurry
Codepen here: https://codepen.io/declanvong/pen/bGJOjZW
# Problem Description We've started getting reports in Canva that text with transparency becomes blurry when edited on Chrome. I've created a minimal reproduction that shows that it's specifically caused by contenteditable + opacity + subpixel transform translate. Removing any of these causes the issue to disappear.
I believe this is a regression (this definitely didn't use to happen in Canva), and it's not reproducible in FF/Safari, nor on Chrome on Android/Windows on the same version, so it seems like a macOS text rendering issue only. I will try to follow up later with a more accurate Chromium version number when this started occurring, but perhaps it's immediately obvious to the code owners.
# Summary contenteditable with opacity and a subpixel translate transform becomes blurry on edit
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: URL Redirection Issue in Chrome Browser
entry.content:
Hello, I am Cyberojas & I have identified a consistent behavior in the Chrome browser where appending certain payloads to the end of URLs consistently leads to unexpected redirections. This behavior occurs across various websites and appears to be triggered by specific characters or patterns within the URL.
VERSION:
Chrome Version: 124.0.6367.60 (Official Build) (64-bit) Operating System: Windows 11 Version 23H2 (Build 22631.3447)
Steps to Reproduce:
1] Open the Chrome browser. 2] Navigate to any website (e.g., https://chromewebstore.google.com). 3] Append a payload, such as "@evil.com", to the end of the URL (e.g., https://chromewebstore.google.com@evil.com). 4] Note the resulting redirection to a different domain (e.g., evil.com).
Expected Behavior:
Appending payloads to the end of URLs should not consistently trigger redirections to external domains unless explicitly programmed by the website.
Impact:
This behavior could potentially be exploited by malicious actors for phishing attacks or to redirect users to malicious websites under the guise of legitimate URLs. Unlike Firefox, Chrome does not provide a warning message to alert users about potential phishing attempts.
Recommendation:
I recommend investigating this behavior further to determine if it poses a security risk or vulnerability within the Chrome browser. Additionally, consider implementing safeguards to prevent automatic redirections triggered by specific URL payloads.
Additional Information:
In contrast to Firefox, Chrome does not provide a warning message to alert users about potential phishing attempts when encountering URLs with appended payloads. For instance, appending certain characters like "@" to the end of a URL might trigger the browser to interpret it as an email address or username, potentially leading to a redirection to a related service or website.

entry.title: Proxy host containing whitespace is invalid
entry.content:
### Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open MacOS system preferences. Navigate to Wi-Fi > Details... > Proxies. 2. Enter Server `" 127.0.0.1"` and Port `8080` into the Web proxy (HTTP) and Secure web proxy (HTTPS) options. 3. Start local proxy server at given address. 4. Open Chrome.
### Problem Description MacOS network proxy settings supports entering whitespace which isn't trimmed upon saving. Single spaces can be difficult to spot which leads to confusion among users with these minor mistakes.
This came to my attention after a user reported their proxy to no longer be working after an update. I believe this regressed due to increased validation of hosts in https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40256677
The GURL constructor trims whitespace by default which avoids this issue when entering Automatic Proxy configurations via PAC URLs.
### Summary MacOS proxy hosts containing whitespace are considered invalid

entry.title: kMaxNumOfRunningEagerPrerendersExceeded spiking started in April for Speculation Rules
entry.content:
I was collecting the key metrics for this week and noticed the Speculation Rules success rate on Linux has dropped from 91% to 47% WoW. Then I realized kMaxNumOfRunningEagerPrerendersExceeded started to increase around April 13th for all platforms: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/j8LToSye5gMhPRf.
Seems to coincide with the adoption of the WordPress plugin: https://wordpress.org/plugins/speculation-rules/advanced/
It's default setting is Moderate eagerness though, so I'm surprised that it is causing any limits to be exceeded. Or would that happen as older prerenders were cancelled as people hovered around links on the site as we only allow a max of two links to be prerendered at a time? If so, then that's WAI so maybe we need to exclude from this stat? Or have a separate stat for when limits are actually exceeded but not WAI?

entry.title: TextFragmentFinder and its related objects cannot be GC?

I am not sure it's a bug or by design. Can you guys take a look on it?

entry.title: Remove old RWI navigator.credentials.get() API
Need a new team query link column for chromium.org account in Chrome Platform quality dashboard tables
entry.content:
We need to add a new team query link column for chromium.org account query in our quality dashboard:
Before Monorail to Buganizer migration, Chrome developers have their chromium.org account paired with google.com account. so chrome developer can use either account and view all bugs assign or cc'ed them for their team.
however, after Buganizer migration, this is no longer the case, the chromium.org not only does not link to google.com account, it also now uses an entirely new URL domain for external developers.
So that has caused Chrome developers to fail to access those bugs that are cc'ed or assigned to them via their chromium.org account via the internal b-corp.google.com link.
We need to: 1) add a column for chromium.org account in dashboard tables 2) change the query URL domain to https://issues.chromium.org/ 2) we cannot use the team query in this query link (since team info is from internal Moma Team API , the external buganizer domain does not aware of the internal team in query.) 3) Require to add the team mapped bug components in query 4) require to remove SLO rule in the query since Chrome SLO rules are not applied to bugs in https://issues.chromium.org/.
URL example(status query parameter might not be necessary): https://issues.chromium.org/u/1/issues?q=componentid:(1456764%20%7C%201456326%20%7C%201457039)%20-hotlistid:(5438043%20%7C%205438152)%20status:(new%20%7C%20assigned%20%7C%20accepted)%20priority:p1%20type:(bug%20%7C%20vulnerability)

entry.title: Multiple 'interactive_ui_tests lacros version skew tests' fail due to a fatal test timeout crash
entry.content:
Individual interactive_ui_tests are not having a result in lacros skew testing.
I suspect that a fatal crashing test takes down the test task with the same tests never getting completion results.
We've been receiving some LUCI analysis bugs for various tests being flaky. Particularly have been looking at [AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/1](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja%3A%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest%3Ainteractive_ui_tests%2FAutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill%2FAutofillInteractiveTest.1?q=V%3Atest_suite%3Dinteractive_ui_tests%2520Lacros%2520version%2520skew%2520testing%2520ash%2520canary+) b/333628073 [AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveTestShadowDom.LabelInSameShadowDomAsField/0](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja%3A%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest%3Ainteractive_ui_tests%2FAutofillInteractiveTestShadowDom.LabelInSameShadowDomAsField%2FAutofillInteractiveTest.0?q=V%3Abuilder%3Dlinux-lacros-rel+V%3Aos%3DUbuntu-22.04+V%3Atest_suite%3Dinteractive_ui_tests%2520Lacros%2520version%2520skew%2520testing%2520ash%2520canary) b/333840465
These tests only appear to be flaky on linux-lacros-rel and particularly in the test suites that are doing "lacros version skew testing": 'interactive_ui_tests Lacros version skew testing ash beta' 'interactive_ui_tests Lacros version skew testing ash canary' 'interactive_ui_tests Lacros version skew testing ash dev' 'interactive_ui_tests Lacros version skew testing ash stable' This happens most often on 'canary' version.
However, when attempting to debug, the log shows that these tests log as an error always at 600-800 ms and always with the message "no test result for...". From an example task https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/task?id=692012797e201010: ``` 2024-04-22T19:35:21.855433Z INFO interactive_ui_tests: [test_launcher.cc(1196)] Starting [AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/0] 2024-04-22T19:35:22.509118Z ERROR interactive_ui_tests: [test_launcher.cc(1294)] no test result for AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/0 [297/302] AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/0 (653 ms) 2024-04-22T19:35:22.509865Z INFO interactive_ui_tests: [test_launcher.cc(1196)] Starting [AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/1] 2024-04-22T19:35:23.163814Z ERROR interactive_ui_tests: [test_launcher.cc(1294)] no test result for AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/1 [298/302] AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/1 (653 ms) ```
When I look further, I see each instance has the same 20 tests fail (and then all fail on retry), all with the same message, all at about the same test execution time, and almost every time after the test [TabDragging/DetachToBrowserInSeparateDisplayTabDragControllerTest.DragMaxTabToNonMaxWindowInSeparateDisplay/1](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja%3A%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest%3Ainteractive_ui_tests%2FDetachToBrowserInSeparateDisplayTabDragControllerTest.DragMaxTabToNonMaxWindowInSeparateDisplay%2FTabDragging.1?q=V%3Abuilder%3Dlinux-lacros-rel+V%3Aos%3DUbuntu-22.04+V%3Atest_suite%3Dinteractive_ui_tests%2520Lacros%2520version%2520skew%2520testing%2520ash%2520canary) has crashed from a timed out run loop after around 1.7 minutes of execution time (when it passes it usually completes in 2-3 seconds). Here is a [Crash Log](https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/task?id=692012797e201010#:~:text=chrome/browser/ui,0%20(81571%20ms))
I suspect that this fatal test crash is taking down the rest of these tests as collateral damage, so something the test runner may need to handle this better?
These are the tests that fail each time that I think are related: ``` AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/0 b/333628073 AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/1 b/333628073 AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveTestShadowDom.LabelInSameShadowDomAsField/0 b/333840465 TabDragging/DetachToBrowserInSeparateDisplayTabDragControllerTest.DragMaxTabToNonMaxWindowInSeparateDisplay/1 b/332856978, b/332927776 MediaRouterIntegrationBrowserTest.Fail_SendMessage/Cast b/333844360 MediaRouterIntegrationBrowserTest.SendAndOnMessage/Cast b/333811373 MediaRouterIntegrationOneUANoReceiverBrowserTest.ReconnectSessionSameTab/Cast b/333842241 All/PDFExtensionInteractiveUITest.FocusForwardTraversal/0 b/332936958 All/PDFExtensionInteractiveUITest.TouchSelectionBounds/0 b/333839976 ProfilePickerParametrizedInteractiveUiTest.ContinueWithoutAccount/WithSearchEngineChoiceStep b/333809828 All/TabHoverCardFadeFooterInteractiveUiTest.BackgroundTabHoverCardContentsHaveCorrectDimensions/0 b/333776707 All/TabHoverCardFadeFooterInteractiveUiTest.FooterHidesOnTabWithoutMemoryUsage/0 b/332930513 All/TabHoverCardFadeFooterInteractiveUiTest.HoverCardFooterMemoryUsagePrefDisabled/1 b/332938498 All/TabHoverCardInteractiveUiTest.HoverCardHidesOnMouseExit/0 b/333776707 All/TabHoverCardInteractiveUiTest.HoverCardShownOnTabFocus/0 b/333776707 All/TabHoverCardInteractiveUiTest.InactiveWindowStaysInactiveOnHover/0 b/333776707 All/TabHoverCardInteractiveUiTest.WidgetNotVisibleOnMousePressAfterTabFocus/1 b/333776707 All/TabHoverCardInteractiveUiTest.WidgetVisibleOnKeyPressAfterTabFocus/1 b/333776707 All/TranslateBubbleViewUITest.ClickPageNotInSourceLanguage/MultipleBubble b/332793355 All/TranslateBubbleViewUITest.NetworkInterruption/Incognito b/333794768 ```

entry.title: Credential manager dialog has no opt-out or backoff
entry.content: When visiting a site like Instagram where the user has a stored password Chrome displays a "Sign in as" prompt. Unlike other permissions, this prompt is modal and offers no option to deny the site the ability to ask again. Visiting the same site in another tab allows it to display the prompt again even if the user has just dismissed it, indicating there's no backoff implemented.

entry.title: Nested subgrids row heights aren't recalculating on hydration. Seems to be a new regression.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Use chrome 124.0.6367.61 2. Create a grid, with subgrid enabled children 3. Inject items into the dom within the subgrid wrapper 4. The height of the grid rows do not recalculate
# Problem Description Injected items into the grid/subgrid on chrome 124.0.6367.61 aren't triggering a recalculation in the grid.
Reproducible here: https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/nested-subgrid-bug-999dgd?file=%2Fsrc%2FPost.tsx%3A56%2C17 https://uploads.codesandbox.io/uploads/user/64aa665c-104f-4b4e-926f-0a87ef2dc275/PiBQ-chrome-124--with-regression.gif
This appears to be a new regression, I have a recording of a how this is working as expected in a previous version of chrome (123.0.6312.106). https://uploads.codesandbox.io/uploads/user/64aa665c-104f-4b4e-926f-0a87ef2dc275/A4GT-chrome-123.gif

entry.title: Investigate not installing some Dispatchers if rules are not set
